overview.business_description: Franco-Dutch airline group formed through merger. One of the world's largest airline groups. Operations include passenger transport (Air France, KLM, Transavia), cargo, and maintenance. Hub at Paris CDG and Amsterdam Schiphol.
business_positives: Split rating: Fitch BBB- (IG) vs S&P BB+ (HY)
Lowest credit margin in history on recent bond
overview.fatal_flaw: Airline industry structural challenges; high fixed costs; fuel price exposure; labor relations
overview.recent_news: Fitch affirmed BBB- stable (May 2025). Issued €650m bonds (Jan 2025) at lowest ever spread. Net debt €7.1bn. Issued €500m perpetual hybrid (May 2025).

credit_opinion.summary: Air France-KLM has achieved investment grade from Fitch while S&P remains at BB+. Strong liquidity and low leverage support the credit. The split rating creates potential for spread compression if S&P upgrades.
key_risks: Labor cost inflation and strike risk
credit_opinion.recommendation: OVERWEIGHT - Split rating opportunity, strong liquidity
